add.title: Share files directly from your device
add.copyAdd: Anyone you give the link to will be able to get the files. Don't add sensitive or copyrighted files.
add.copySend: IPFS gives the files a unique fingerprint called a CID that is used to find them again on the network.
add.copyKeep: You are sharing the content from your device. Your friends can help you co-host the content by also keeping the share link open in their browser.

download.title: Get files directly from other devices
download.copyGet: You can download individual files or, if you want to keep the files structure, click on the download all button.
download.copyKeepPage: You can help co-host the content by also keeping this page open in the browser. This way you are sharing the content from your device.
download.copyKeepDaemon: You can help co-host the content by also keeping your daemon running. This way you are sharing the content from your device.
download.copySend: IPFS gives the files a unique fingerprint called a CID that is used to find them again on the network.

box.runningDaemon: You need a <1>running daemon</1> to add files to IPFS.
box.configureDaemon: Make sure you <1>configure your IPFS API</1> to allow cross-origin (CORS) requests:
box.runDaemon: Then, start an IPFS daemon in your terminal:
box.footNote: If you add more files after getting a share link, it will be updated. Don't forget to copy the latest to get the full files list.
box.largeFilesWarning: If you experience issues when downloading files larger than 1GB, please install <1>IPFS Desktop</1> or <3>IPFS Companion</3> for improved performance.
